regional.name: Sub-Saharan Africa
regional.interpretation: The epicenter of global multidimensional poverty. High prevalence and intensity indicate entrenched structural challenges.

regional.name: South Asia
regional.interpretation: Second highest region. Despite economic growth, high deprivation endures among marginalized populations.

regional.name: Arab States
regional.interpretation: Conflict and instability may explain why rates remain higher than expected for wealthier states.

regional.name: East Asia & Pacific
regional.interpretation: Moderate poverty. Huge reductions in the last 20 years, but work remains to reach <5% poverty.

regional.name: Latin America & Caribbean
regional.interpretation: Slightly lower poverty reflecting targeted social programs, but inequality persists.

regional.name: Europe & Central Asia
regional.interpretation: Multidimensional poverty is virtually eliminated due to robust social safety nets.
